“You weren't the only one.” You respond. Your blade is at a sticking point, and you plant your foot on his shoulder to remove it, in a splash of ichor. “You saved me?”

“I merely seized the initiative.” He speaks. Kainzo and Nel draw closer, cautiously, as the wind slows and the flames die away. “It's more than likely I would have become her next target. Do not mistake my gesture for kindness; are we not enemies, after all?”

“Will she still continue to haunt me? Velika.” You ask, moving past the question.

“Perhaps.” He responds. “Or, perhaps she and I both will fade from memory together.”

“Fine. One more thing.” You say. “The Celestial Gems...”

“I carry a trinket with me.” The Artificer says, slumping slightly. “There is only so much I know. By the time you have returned it to its rightful place in my study, you will know as well.”

“Artificer.” Kainzo says. “Are you also a player?”

“We are all players, in some game.” In all of his weakness, he scoffs. “What are you playing at?”

“Fine.” The Crimson Guardian hisses, unsatisfied with the answer. “Then, tell me: is the past so terrible as you say?”

“No—there is nothing more beautiful, or I would not have created this place.” He says. “Nor would I have tried to restore my love to form. Perhaps all of this would have been different. But all that I have said is true. Loss is reality. It cannot be restored in effigy. Take heed, and ensure that you too... do not succumb.”

With a dull thud, he collapses. Likewise, you hear a distant, contented sigh. Kjorikos and Velika die together. They lie side by side, their ichor mixing in the dirt.
